original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields up, rupee opens stronger
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT- Sri Lanka’s bond yields opened higher on Thursday and the rupee opened at 315/316 against the US dollar in the spot market, dealers said.
A bond maturing on 01.09.2027 closed at 28.75/85 percent, steady from 28.60/90 percent at yesterday’s close.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2026 closed at 30.60/75 percent on Thursday, up from 30.50/75 percent at yesterday’s close.
The rupee opened at 315/316 against the US dollar in the spot market appreciated from the last close at 317.50/318.50. (Colombo/May11/2023)
